FERMI: Italian Nobel laureate, created the first nuclear reactor, well-known for wielding a six-inch slide rule
DIRAC: English mathematician and physicist, used Lorentz invariance and quantum mechanics to predict antimatter
LASER: Source of focused light that uses stimulated emission
BORN: German physicist, postulated that squares of amplitudes are measurement probabilities
BOHR: Danish physicist, popularised the Copenhagen interpretation
EVERETT: American physicist, proposed the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics in his doctoral dissertation

UNITARY: Adjective to describe a transformation that preserves norms of vectors
PAULI: Austrian physicist, the first to propose existence of neutrinos
ENTANGLE: (verb,) 'Mix' two particles such that you cannot specify the state of one without specifying that of the other
QUBIT: Two-level quantum system, unit of quantum information
DECOHERE: Lose quantum information by interacting with environment, typically irreversibly
PLANCK: Unit of 'quantum angular momentum', also a physicist
